Why Atlassian is a dream company for many?Atlassian is frequently recognised as a leading employer for multiple reasons, including their recent implementation of a permanent work-from-home policy for their employees. Hey #LinkedIn community! 👋🌍Here are some key factors that contribute to Atlassian's outstanding reputation as an exceptional workplace:Culture and Values: Atlassian places a strong emphasis on its company culture and values. They prioritize openness, transparency, and collaboration. Employees are encouraged to voice their opinions, contribute ideas, and take ownership of their work. The company fosters an inclusive environment where diversity is celebrated and employees are respected.Work-Life Balance: Atlassian recognises the importance of work-life balance and promotes a healthy blend of personal and professional life. They offer flexible working hours and remote work options, allowing employees to maintain a better equilibrium between work commitments and personal obligations.Focus on Innovation: Atlassian encourages innovation and creativity among its employees. They provide dedicated time for employees to work on personal projects and explore new ideas through initiatives like the "ShipIt Days" or "Hackathons." This emphasis on innovation helps foster a dynamic and forward-thinking work environment.Career Development: Atlassian prioritises the growth and development of its employees. They offer various learning and development opportunities, including mentorship programs, internal training, and access to conferences and events. The company supports career advancement and provides resources for employees to enhance their skills and knowledge.Attractive Perks and Benefits: Atlassian offers a range of benefits and perks to its employees. These may include competitive salaries, stock options, health and wellness programs, generous leave policies, employee assistance programs, and more. The company aims to ensure that employees feel valued and supported.Impactful Work: Atlassian's products and services have a significant impact on the tech industry and beyond. Their tools, such as Jira, Confluence, and Trello, are widely used by teams worldwide, enabling collaboration and productivity. Working at Atlassian allows employees to contribute to meaningful projects that have a real-world impact.Community Engagement: Atlassian actively participates in social responsibility initiatives and encourages employees to give back to their communities. They have programs that support volunteering, charitable donations, and social impact projects. It's important to note that while Atlassian is often praised as a great employer, individual experiences may vary. Different people have diverse preferences and priorities, so it's essential to consider what matters most to you personally when evaluating potential employers.Do follow me here for such updates Harshit Trehan#Atlassian #DreamEmployer #WorkplaceExcellence

👩‍❤️‍👨In the journey of a successful marriage, it's not just about the smooth and easy moments, but also how we respond to the unexpected twists and turns that life throws at us. It's during these challenging times that the true strength of a marriage is revealed.🗣 💚 Instead of letting these issues tear us apart, a successful marriage is built on a foundation of mutual respect, open communication, and a willingness to work together to find solutions. It's about embracing imperfections and facing the obstacles hand in hand, knowing that we are stronger together.⛰ When we approach unexpected issues with patience, empathy, and understanding, we create a safe space for each other to express ourselves and find common ground. It's through this unwavering support and respect that we forge a deep connection and foster a thriving relationship.📍 Remember, a successful marriage is not about avoiding problems, but about facing them head-on with love and resilience. It's about growing together, learning from each other, and continually evolving as individuals and as a couple.❤️👫So, let's cherish and nurture our marriages, celebrating the strength we build through the challenges we overcome.🔗 ⬆ Let's build a better LinkedIn network together by connecting, growing, and inspiring each other. 📝🚀 Angular Interview Questions 🚀📝Hey LinkedIn fam! 👋 Are you looking to level up your Angular skills? Today, I wanted to share some helpful angular Interview questions that will enhance your understanding and productivity when working with Angular. Let's dive right in:1️⃣ TypeScript: Angular is built with TypeScript, a superset of JavaScript. Make sure you have a solid understanding of TypeScript concepts like classes, interfaces, and modules to leverage the full power of Angular.2️⃣ Components: Angular follows a component-based architecture. Each component encapsulates its own logic, HTML template, and styles. Remember to keep components small, focused, and reusable for easier maintenance and code organization.3️⃣ Data Binding: Angular provides powerful data binding capabilities. Use interpolation ({{ }}) for one-way data binding, and square brackets ([]) for property binding. Additionally, use parentheses (()) for event binding and two-way binding with the [(ngModel)] directive.4️⃣ Directives: Directives are a way to extend HTML with custom behavior. Angular provides built-in directives like ngIf, ngFor, and ngStyle. You can also create your own directives to manipulate the DOM or add custom functionality.5️⃣ Services: Services in Angular are singletons that provide shared functionality and data across components. Use services to handle business logic, API calls, and state management. Remember to inject services into components via dependency injection.6️⃣ Routing: Angular's powerful routing module allows you to build single-page applications (SPAs) with multiple views. Configure routes using the RouterModule and navigate between views using the routerLink directive.7️⃣ Reactive Forms: When working with forms, Angular's reactive forms approach provides a robust solution. Use the FormBuilder and FormControl classes to create dynamic forms with validation and form state tracking.8️⃣ Lifecycle Hooks: Angular provides lifecycle hooks that allow you to tap into component creation, rendering, and destruction. Explore hooks like ngOnInit, ngOnChanges, and ngOnDestroy to perform actions at specific stages of a component's lifecycle.9️⃣ Dependency Injection: Angular's dependency injection system is at the core of its architecture. Understand how to leverage it to provide and consume dependencies throughout your application.🔟 Testing: Angular has excellent support for testing. Use frameworks like Jasmine and tools like Karma or Jest to write unit tests for your components, services, and pipes. Testing is crucial for maintaining code quality and preventing regressions.If you found these notes helpful, don't forget to like and share. Feel free to connect with me Ashish Anand if you have any questions or want to discuss further. Happy coding! 💻#Angular #JavaScript #WebDevelopment #FrontEndDevelopment #LinkedInLearning #html #event #business #coding #data #management #share #quality #architecture #like #power #productivity

My New setup in 2023 as a Founder and Developer in my startup, along with my YouTube channel! Managing work efficiently is crucial, and here are a few things that have greatly helped me:1️⃣ I've dedicated separate laptops for my startup and YouTube, optimizing productivity and focus.2️⃣ The addition of a vertical screen has been a game-changer for managing front-end code. With front-end development often involving extensive coding, this setup brings clarity and ease.3️⃣ Incorporating an iPad into my morning routine has boosted my brainstorming sessions. I now review all the tasks I need to tackle for the day, right from the start.4️⃣ Thanks to an incredible iPad stand, I can charge three devices simultaneously—AirPods, iPhone, and iPad—without worrying about tangled charging cables.5️⃣ To maintain a tidy workspace, I've implemented a practical cable manager, significantly reducing clutter on my desk.As a founder, it's crucial to optimize both productivity and creativity.I'm thrilled to share a full video showcasing my setup, offering valuable insights for founders and developers alike. Check it out on my youtube channel or in the first comment below!Feel free to share your thoughts and suggestions. Let's optimize our work environments together! 💪🔥#coding #startup #productivity #work #developer

JUGGERNAUTThere’s a lot we can know about a word, just by going deep into the origin of the word, and how it was formed. For example, the word “tamarind” is derived from the Arabic word “Tamar-e-hind” meaning “dates from India”. Just by looking into the origin of this word, we can infer that it was an entity transferred from India to Arab region.Similarly, the word “Juggernaut” means “a huge, powerful, and overwhelming force”. More interesting is the origin of the word “Juggernaut”. It originates from the Sanskrit word Jaggannath, and was derived from the event of Jaggannath rath yatra, where the idols of Mahaprabhu is carried in an enormous carriage.ଜୟ ଜଗନ୍ନାଥ | জয় জগন্নাথ | Jai Jaggannath

NLP IMPORTANT NOTES 📝 “Unlocking the Power of Natural Language Processing (NLP): Harnessing the Future of Communication. 🚀✨In today's digital era, NLP is revolutionizing how we interact with technology and enabling machines to understand human language. As an AI language model, I've witnessed firsthand the incredible impact NLP has on our lives.Imagine having a personal assistant that can comprehend and respond to your voice commands accurately, like Amazon Alexa or Apple's Siri. NLP makes this possible by analyzing and interpreting human language, making our interactions with technology more seamless and intuitive.But NLP goes beyond virtual assistants. It has applications in various industries, such as healthcare, finance, customer service, and more. For example, NLP algorithms can extract vital information from medical records, helping doctors make faster and more accurate diagnoses. It can also assist businesses in analyzing customer feedback to improve their products and services.As NLP continues to evolve, its potential for transforming our daily lives is limitless. Join me in embracing this exciting journey and discovering how NLP is shaping the future of communication. 📝Father - The unsung hero 🎯Some lessons to derive from this post: ✔️Dads are the unsung heroes. The heroes whose sacrifices and efforts often go unnoticed, but they are also the heroes who will always be there when their loved ones are in need.✔️Father's love is very unique. Not so much expressive, yet a guiding light in all our thoughts and actions. ✔️The purpose of this message is to highlight that both parents are equally important in the conditioning of their children. ✔️Stephen Kendrick outlines seven roles that a father plays in the life of his family: 1)Provider, 2)Protector, 3)Leader, 4)Teacher, 5) Helper, 6) Encourager, and friend. ( similar of a role that a mom plays ) ✔️Much like a mother, the level 🎚️ of father's influence and involvement can have a profound impact on children's development. Why Atlassian is a dream company for many?Atlassian is frequently recognised as a leading employer for multiple reasons, including their recent implementation of a permanent work-from-home policy for their employees. Hey #LinkedIn community! 👋🌍Here are some key factors that contribute to Atlassian's outstanding reputation as an exceptional workplace:Culture and Values: Atlassian places a strong emphasis on its company culture and values. They prioritize openness, transparency, and collaboration. Employees are encouraged to voice their opinions, contribute ideas, and take ownership of their work. The company fosters an inclusive environment where diversity is celebrated and employees are respected.Work-Life Balance: Atlassian recognises the importance of work-life balance and promotes a healthy blend of personal and professional life. They offer flexible working hours and remote work options, allowing employees to maintain a better equilibrium between work commitments and personal obligations.Focus on Innovation: Atlassian encourages innovation and creativity among its employees. They provide dedicated time for employees to work on personal projects and explore new ideas through initiatives like the "ShipIt Days" or "Hackathons." This emphasis on innovation helps foster a dynamic and forward-thinking work environment.Career Development: Atlassian prioritises the growth and development of its employees. They offer various learning and development opportunities, including mentorship programs, internal training, and access to conferences and events. The company supports career advancement and provides resources for employees to enhance their skills and knowledge.Attractive Perks and Benefits: Atlassian offers a range of benefits and perks to its employees. These may include competitive salaries, stock options, health and wellness programs, generous leave policies, employee assistance programs, and more. The company aims to ensure that employees feel valued and supported.Impactful Work: Atlassian's products and services have a significant impact on the tech industry and beyond. Their tools, such as Jira, Confluence, and Trello, are widely used by teams worldwide, enabling collaboration and productivity. Working at Atlassian allows employees to contribute to meaningful projects that have a real-world impact.Community Engagement: Atlassian actively participates in social responsibility initiatives and encourages employees to give back to their communities. They have programs that support volunteering, charitable donations, and social impact projects. It's important to note that while Atlassian is often praised as a great employer, individual experiences may vary. Different people have diverse preferences and priorities, so it's essential to consider what matters most to you personally when evaluating potential employers.Do follow me here for such updates Harshit Trehan#Atlassian #DreamEmployer #WorkplaceExcellence

How Nicotex Helped Me Overcome My Worst Habit and a Heartfelt Thanks to CiplaBreaking free from the clutches of a harmful addiction is no easy task. As someone who struggled with the grip of smoking, I understand the challenges and the strength it takes to break free from this habit. In my journey towards a healthier lifestyle, Nicotex, a revolutionary product from Cipla, played a pivotal role. In this article, I want to share my personal experience of how Nicotex helped me overcome my worst habit and express my heartfelt gratitude to Cipla for manufacturing such an effective solution.The Transition Phase:The journey of quitting smoking is not just about breaking the physical dependency; it also involves tackling the psychological aspects. Nicotex played a crucial role in both these aspects. The controlled nicotine release from the gum helped alleviate my cravings and reduced the intensity of withdrawal symptoms. Additionally, the act of chewing Nicotex gum provided a substitute for the oral fixation associated with smoking.Gradual Reduction:Nicotex's unique feature of gradually reducing the nicotine content over time was instrumental in my journey. I started with the appropriate nicotine strength based on my smoking habits and gradually reduced it as per the recommended plan. This step-by-step approach allowed my body and mind to adjust to decreasing nicotine levels without experiencing severe withdrawal symptoms.The Road to Freedom:After consistent efforts and with the aid of Nicotex, I finally managed to break free from the chains of smoking. The transformation I experienced in my overall health and well-being was remarkable. I felt a surge of energy that had been dulled for years. Quitting smoking has undoubtedly been one of the best decisions I have made for myself.Conclusion:Overcoming an addiction is a personal triumph that requires determination, support, and the right tools. Nicotex, with its unique formulation and gradual reduction approach, provided me with the necessary support to break free from the clutches of smoking. It not only helped manage my cravings but also played a vital role in addressing the psychological aspects of quitting. I wholeheartedly thank Cipla for their role in developing Nicotex and their unwavering commitment to helping individuals lead healthier lives. If you or someone you know is struggling with smoking, I highly recommend considering Nicotex as an effective aid in your journey towards a smoke-free life.#experience #energy #health #gratitude #transformation #smokingcessation #smoking #cipla #nicotine

Imagine if a company made water out of air. Uravu Labs did it.They’re making 1,000 litres of water out of thin air every single day.You may think this is impossible, but two students of NIT Calicut have made it possible.The story dates back to Uravu Labs founders Swapnil Shrivastav and Venkatesh RY's  college days when a drought-like situation forced them to think about the water scarcity problem. Hence, they were determined to find a sustainable solution to this prevailing problem. Water scarcity is a significant problem in our country. According to a report, water scarcity in India is expected to rise from 933 million in 2016 to 1.7 to 2.4 billion by 2050.This is an alarming situation, yet most people are unaware of it.→ Although water returned to the campus after a month, their thirst for solving the problem didn’t die. That’s how the water tech startup ‘Uravu Labs’ was founded in 2017.→ After months of research, they considered making water out of thin air. This process was familiar to the world- countries like Israel and the USA had already been making water with thin air. However, the production cost needed to be lowered, and according to the duo, high production costs were never an option. Hence, they needed to find another way.→ The duo tried and tested every possible way to make a crude prototype using air conditioners, car radiators, etc. But luck didn't seem to be on their side. By the time the product reached its minimum viable product (MVP) stage, the duo had graduated from college. However, no one was interested in their product- it didn't look promising.→ For two years, they did not get any chance. In between, they kept working on their product and were also able to make a crude prototype. This time luck was on their side. → Uravu Labs emerged as one of the top 5 finalists of the Tata Group-backed Water Abundance XPRIZE and was granted $50,000. This was enough to set up a unit and work on this project full-time.→ The duo welcomed Pardeep Garg and BALAJI GB as co-founders of the water tech startup in 2018.→ Uravu Labs plans to produce 1 lakh litres of water in the next 24 months, with its current capacity of 1,000 litres daily.Will Uravu Labs bring a permanent solution to the water scarcity problem that exists not only in India but also in the world?#tech #startup #waterconservation

📝🚀 Angular Interview Questions 🚀📝Hey LinkedIn fam! 👋 Are you looking to level up your Angular skills? Today, I wanted to share some helpful angular Interview questions that will enhance your understanding and productivity when working with Angular. Let's dive right in:1️⃣ TypeScript: Angular is built with TypeScript, a superset of JavaScript. Make sure you have a solid understanding of TypeScript concepts like classes, interfaces, and modules to leverage the full power of Angular.2️⃣ Components: Angular follows a component-based architecture. Each component encapsulates its own logic, HTML template, and styles. Remember to keep components small, focused, and reusable for easier maintenance and code organization.3️⃣ Data Binding: Angular provides powerful data binding capabilities. Use interpolation ({{ }}) for one-way data binding, and square brackets ([]) for property binding. Additionally, use parentheses (()) for event binding and two-way binding with the [(ngModel)] directive.4️⃣ Directives: Directives are a way to extend HTML with custom behavior. Angular provides built-in directives like ngIf, ngFor, and ngStyle. You can also create your own directives to manipulate the DOM or add custom functionality.5️⃣ Services: Services in Angular are singletons that provide shared functionality and data across components. Use services to handle business logic, API calls, and state management. Remember to inject services into components via dependency injection.6️⃣ Routing: Angular's powerful routing module allows you to build single-page applications (SPAs) with multiple views. Configure routes using the RouterModule and navigate between views using the routerLink directive.7️⃣ Reactive Forms: When working with forms, Angular's reactive forms approach provides a robust solution. Use the FormBuilder and FormControl classes to create dynamic forms with validation and form state tracking.8️⃣ Lifecycle Hooks: Angular provides lifecycle hooks that allow you to tap into component creation, rendering, and destruction. Explore hooks like ngOnInit, ngOnChanges, and ngOnDestroy to perform actions at specific stages of a component's lifecycle.9️⃣ Dependency Injection: Angular's dependency injection system is at the core of its architecture. Understand how to leverage it to provide and consume dependencies throughout your application.🔟 Testing: Angular has excellent support for testing. Use frameworks like Jasmine and tools like Karma or Jest to write unit tests for your components, services, and pipes. Testing is crucial for maintaining code quality and preventing regressions.If you found these notes helpful, don't forget to like and share. Feel free to connect with me Ashish Anand if you have any questions or want to discuss further. Happy coding! 💻#Angular #JavaScript #WebDevelopment #FrontEndDevelopment #LinkedInLearning #html #event #business #coding #data #management #share #quality #architecture #like #power #productivity

𝗣𝗮𝘁𝗮𝗻𝗷𝗮𝗹𝗶 𝗬𝗼𝗴𝗮 𝗦𝘂𝘁𝗿𝗮.𝗦𝘂𝘁𝗿𝗮 𝗻𝘂𝗺𝗯𝗲𝗿 𝟮.योगश्चित्तवृत्तिनिरोधः"Yoga is the suppression of the Compulsive Cyclical    Tendencies of the mind."The second sutra of Patanjali's Yoga Sutras is a foundational statement of the yogic path. It states that 𝒚𝒐𝒈𝒂 𝒊𝒔 𝒕𝒉𝒆 𝒑𝒓𝒂𝒄𝒕𝒊𝒄𝒆 𝒐𝒇 𝒃𝒓𝒊𝒏𝒈𝒊𝒏𝒈 𝒕𝒉𝒆 𝒎𝒊𝒏𝒅 𝒖𝒏𝒅𝒆𝒓 𝒄𝒐𝒏𝒕𝒓𝒐𝒍.The mind is constantly in flux, flitting from one thought to the next. This constant movement of the mind is what prevents us from achieving true peace and happiness. Yoga teaches us how to still the mind and focus our attention on the present moment. When we can do this, we can begin to experience the true nature of reality.The sutra goes on to say that there are eight limbs of yoga, which are the practices that help us to control the mind. These limbs are:Yama: moral restraintsNiyama: observancesAsana: posturesPranayama: breath controlPratyahara: withdrawal of the sensesDharana: concentrationDhyana: meditationSamadhi: absorptionThe eight limbs of yoga are not a linear path. We do not need to master all eight limbs in order to experience the benefits of yoga. We can start with any limb that we feel drawn to, and gradually work our way through the other limbs. The important thing is to practice regularly and to be patient. With time and effort, we can all learn to control the mind and achieve true peace and happiness.𝗛𝗮𝗽𝗽𝘆 𝗜𝗻𝘁𝗲𝗿𝗻𝗮𝘁𝗶𝗼𝗻𝗮𝗹 𝗬𝗼𝗴𝗮 𝗗𝗮𝘆.Follow me Sridhar Iyengar .Press the 🔔 icon.Video Social Media.#yogapractice #experience #happiness

Source Code for DragGAN has been finally released!!!Drag Your GAN: Allows users to precisely & interactively manipulate the shape, layout and pose of entities in the generated images [Interactive Point-based Manipulation on the Generative Image Manifold]Imagine this scenario: You're a skilled sports coach, and you have access to innovative technology based on this tool. With this, you can revolutionize the world of sports training and strategy by leveraging its advanced capabilities to create interactive and immersive simulations of competitive matches. This cutting-edge tool allows you to precisely manipulate gameplay, modify tactics, and even simulate varying environmental conditions to optimize your team's performance. By incorporating such a gameplay solution into your coaching process, you can refine strategies, enhance athletes' skills, and create compelling training experiences that give your team a competitive edge. One can have the unprecedented opportunity to transform sports coaching, empowering athletes to excel and achieve their full potential on the field.The flexibility allows for the creation of captivating transformations - morphing between different forms or reshaping landscapes.The researchers introduced an interactive technique in which users can drag any point in an image to a desired position, enabling precise control. This approach extends beyond specific categories and allows manipulation of diverse objects while maintaining realistic results even in complex scenarios like generating missing content and deforming shapes while preserving object rigidity.Author's Implementation: They perform motion supervision using shifted path loss on generator feature maps, which drives the handle points (red dots) to move towards the target points (blue dots) and the point tracking step updates the handle points to track the object in the image, this process continues until the handle points reach their corresponding target points.The Limitations highlighted in the paper include -potential artifacts when deviating from the training distribution and tracking drift in texture-less regions. Socially, it requires adherence to personality rights and privacy regulations to prevent misuse in creating manipulated images.Paper: arxiv.org/abs/2305.10973Github code: https://lnkd.in/eqFxudB2#artificialintelligence  #deeplearning #gans#technology

Shockingly, my master's and bachelor's degree, both aren't enough to get a job in the UK! I had very less time to prepare for my masters due to a delayed offer, but I did everything in 2 weeks, from visa to student loan and came to achieve my dreams.  I had faced so many difficulties during my course; I had someone steal my passport & BRP from my room, faced burnout, difficulty finding a house, rising costs, loneliness, and the list goes on...  I graduated in Dec 2022. I was barely surviving, financially unstable, anxious and burnout. During all of this I was giving my 100%, even though there were unimaginable difficulties. And even after graduating successfully, things only became worse.  Looking for a job as an international student (graduate) has been extremely heartbreaking. There has been no value for me, my degree, or capabilities. I have applied for more than 300+ jobs and got a handful of useful feedbacks. At times, I had to wait for months together after an interview only to have no reply or feedback. Hiring managers need to understand that these are not just job applications but that there are actual people behind these applications! We are talented and put a lot of effort into our applications and would really would really appreciate some feedback! I feel as an international student, we go through a lot. Being away from family, taking care of ourselves, dealing with burnout and stress, all while doing a master’s degree. All this is not easy! We international students are talented, capable, and more than anything RESILIENT. Our determination to come back up and achieve things is impeccable.   If you are someone who moved out from your home country and tried to figure it all out on your own, I have immense respect for you!  I'm hoping things change and people GIVE INTERNATIONAL STUDENTS A CHANCE!  I came here exhausted, worried, and terrified. I'm still having trouble finding a job, just like many of my fellow international students. But I feel secure in my personal development and how far I've come! I'm beginning to realise how much work it took to get here. So here I'm putting myself out there every day, looking for jobs and hoping I'll find something soon... :)Please comment 👍 for more reach! PS: Shoutout to Farhoon Asim for giving me advice and resources for my job hunt! #blogpost #internationalstudents #masterslife #jobhunt #UK #architecture #masterplanning #interview #change #work #personaldevelopment #comment

Imagine if a company made water out of air. Uravu Labs did it.They’re making 1,000 litres of water out of thin air every single day.You may think this is impossible, but two students of NIT Calicut have made it possible.The story dates back to Uravu Labs founders Swapnil Shrivastav and Venkatesh RY's  college days when a drought-like situation forced them to think about the water scarcity problem. Hence, they were determined to find a sustainable solution to this prevailing problem. Water scarcity is a significant problem in our country. According to a report, water scarcity in India is expected to rise from 933 million in 2016 to 1.7 to 2.4 billion by 2050.This is an alarming situation, yet most people are unaware of it.→ Although water returned to the campus after a month, their thirst for solving the problem didn’t die. That’s how the water tech startup ‘Uravu Labs’ was founded in 2017.→ After months of research, they considered making water out of thin air. This process was familiar to the world- countries like Israel and the USA had already been making water with thin air. However, the production cost needed to be lowered, and according to the duo, high production costs were never an option. Hence, they needed to find another way.→ The duo tried and tested every possible way to make a crude prototype using air conditioners, car radiators, etc. But luck didn't seem to be on their side. By the time the product reached its minimum viable product (MVP) stage, the duo had graduated from college. However, no one was interested in their product- it didn't look promising.→ For two years, they did not get any chance. In between, they kept working on their product and were also able to make a crude prototype. This time luck was on their side. → Uravu Labs emerged as one of the top 5 finalists of the Tata Group-backed Water Abundance XPRIZE and was granted $50,000. This was enough to set up a unit and work on this project full-time.→ The duo welcomed Pardeep Garg and BALAJI GB as co-founders of the water tech startup in 2018.→ Uravu Labs plans to produce 1 lakh litres of water in the next 24 months, with its current capacity of 1,000 litres daily.Will Uravu Labs bring a permanent solution to the water scarcity problem that exists not only in India but also in the world?#tech #startup #waterconservation

My friends and colleagues would tell you that being impacted by the recent Meta #layoffs has been mentally rough for me, but here's to trying to move forward with grace - I think it's important to recognize that in the society we live in, employment is a privilege, not a right - though certainly it should be both. That we are ultimately viewed as a statistic in the face of critical business decisions is an inevitable corporate reality, especially in big tech companies. While undoubtedly frustrating, such decisions are ultimately impersonal, and it is not lost on me that to have had Meta as my first job, and to have found employment outside Manila, has been in itself a massive privilege.There is a very long list of things to be grateful for. On top of that list, as my manager would say, is the people. The one truth that has remained constant throughout each chapter of my life is that my community makes me, and I am immensely grateful for the people I've worked with, grown with, and learned from both professionally and personally. The job might not always last, but the people and the impact they make on us are there to stay forever. So this is a massive thank you to my manager, my team, my cross-functionals, and my friends, who have collectively made my experience at Meta as meaningful as it was, no matter how short.I'm excited to embark on the next chapter of my career, and I would appreciate any support from my network, particularly through the following:👉🏼 Leads, recommendations, or referrals for jobs you think I might be suited for (i.e. project management, risk management, vendor management, ops roles in tech) 👉🏼 Profile recommendations and skill endorsements from the people I've worked with👉🏼 Reactions and comments on my post for extended reachPlease feel free to reach out to me here on LinkedIn or email at ng.jerome.c@gmail.com for any recommendations, opportunities, or even a chat over coffee if you're going through something similar! Thanks so much for your support! 💪🏼

JUGGERNAUTThere’s a lot we can know about a word, just by going deep into the origin of the word, and how it was formed. For example, the word “tamarind” is derived from the Arabic word “Tamar-e-hind” meaning “dates from India”. Just by looking into the origin of this word, we can infer that it was an entity transferred from India to Arab region.Similarly, the word “Juggernaut” means “a huge, powerful, and overwhelming force”. More interesting is the origin of the word “Juggernaut”. It originates from the Sanskrit word Jaggannath, and was derived from the event of Jaggannath rath yatra, where the idols of Mahaprabhu is carried in an enormous carriage.ଜୟ ଜଗନ୍ନାଥ | জয় জগন্নাথ | Jai Jaggannath

I saw it coming.The signs were there and team members were getting deactivated. This wasn't like my first layoff. That one was filled with emotion, confusion, and shame.This one I understood. Nobody wants to lay off their team, especially at small startups. But business is business, and my time had come.I spent my last few minutes making up a custom background. I waited until the point in the call when it was official (because imagine how awkward that would be if I wasn't being laid off...), and then I uploaded this "in memoriam" background. It was well received ( 🙏 ) and I was able to use my last few moments how I wanted: to say what I needed to say, to express my gratitude for 4 years of learning and development. To be truly present in the call and have a meaningful final sign-off.I don't think this will be my last layoff. "In this economy" it feels inevitable. But I know that my accomplishments and worth aren't tied to this decision. I can be proud of the professional growth I accomplished and be grateful for the team that took the journey with me.Now I just need to find the next team that will appreciate my sense of humor as much as this one did. 🥁 ---If you know of anyone hiring for a marketing manager, my areas of focus include content, lifecycle, community, and brand! I've managed teams of 10+ and care deeply about the human experience, whether you're a customer or a teammate. Cheers for any references!#marketingmanager #layoffs #openforwork

Multiple ways to fetch API in React You Should Know! #react The choice of which method to use depends on your project requirements, preferences, and the complexity of your data-fetching needs.1.Build in fetch function: The Fetch API is a built-in web API in modern browsers that allows making HTTP requests. You can use the fetch() function to fetch data from an API endpoint. It returns a Promise that resolves to the response object, which you can handle using .then() and .catch(). #complexity #project #data 2.Axios: Axios is a popular third-party library for making HTTP requests. It provides a simple and convenient API for fetching data. You can install Axios using npm or yarn, and then use it to send GET, POST, PUT, DELETE, etc., requests to your API endpoints.It helps to deliver payload without writing less code then Typical fetch method also there is interseptor function that helps to handle error easily.#axios 3.XMLHttpRequest: The XMLHttpRequest object is a traditional way of making HTTP requests. While it’s a lower-level API compared to Fetch and Axios, it’s still widely supported. You can use new XMLHttpRequest() to create an instance, set up event listeners, and call methods like open(), send(), and onreadystatechange to handle the response.#xml 4.React Query/Tanstack Query: React Query is a powerful data-fetching library specifically designed for React applications. It provides hooks and utilities to manage and cache API data, handle data fetching, caching, pagination, and more. React Query simplifies the process of fetching and managing API data with built-in features like caching,isLoading, refetching, and background data synchronization.It also use for large application where multiple data need to fetch multiple components.You can set the base url to the hook then call the hook in the component then fetch the data easily. #tanstackquery #reactquery 5.GraphQL: GraphQL is a query language that allows you to request specific data from an API endpoint. It provides a flexible and efficient way of fetching data, allowing the client to define the structure of the response. You can use libraries like Apollo Client or Relay to integrate GraphQL into your React application.#graphql

Mind your Mind “Don’t let others ruin your happiness”, one of my friends told me while referring to the constant politics at the office. Most of the times political correctness is important to succeed than mere performance. That’s a fact. At times we take the office scene way too seriously. The value of earning a livelihood most of the times is overestimated. Probably, it’s the attachment to our posts and positions which doesn’t allow us to see ourselves out of the office setting.I too like many other professionals struggle with this challenge. The only good thing is I have started to notice it more often than before. I can’t stop the mind from thinking but what definitely I can control is the focus of my thinking 🧐 The epic text Bhagavad Gita explains मन्मना भव मद्भ‍क्तो मद्याजी मां नमस्कुरु ।मामेवैष्यसि युक्त्वैवमात्मानं मत्परायण: ॥ Engage your mind always in thinking of Me, become My devotee, offer obeisances to Me and worship Me. Being completely absorbed in Me, surely you will come to Me.(9.34)So the key is the ‘engagement/focus of the mind’. By shifting our focus we will able to free our mind and ourselves from the artificial shackles which is binding us. When you change your focus your goals and attachments automatically change. Here’s what can help us from coming out of that vicious circle ⭕️ 1. Mantra Meditation relaxes the mind like anything. It’s kind of reset the whole system. Do it for 10 mins to begin with everyday 🧘‍♂️ 2. Make a list of 10 things which your profession can’t provide you. You will be shocked to see the list has the most important things of our life. 3. Improve your engagement level at places other than office - home, social centre, gym, temple etc. Open up more avenues for your mind. 4. Last but not the least - READ BOOKS regularly. It stimulates the deep inherent power of the mind like anything. Don’t stop thinking 🤔 or try to become thoughtless you can’t do that, just shift the focus of your thoughts. #corporatemythology #mindfulness #leadershipsutras

My Off-Campus Amazon Interview Experience:I applied through a referral from a college senior, which undoubtedly expedited my application process.A few weeks after applying, I received a link to an online assessment test, which took place on the Hackerrank platform. The assessment consisted of two coding questions that were intricately linked to Amazon's day-to-day operations. I was able to tackle the problems using Breadth First Search and priority queues. After a brief period, I received a call informing me that I had successfully passed the online assessment round. Then the onsite rounds were scheduled, which were conducted virtually using Amazon's internal tools. Round-1: The initial round was a DSA (Data Structures and Algorithms) round. The interviewer began by asking me to introduce myself and shared insights about his team. We then delved into two problem-solving exercises, one involving trees and the other centred around graphs. I confidently presented my solutions and discussed the time and space complexities associated with each approach. Round-2: This round, too, was focused on DSA. I was presented with two problems, for which I provided a greedy solution for the first and a hashmap solution for the second. To ensure clarity, I conducted dry runs on the inputs provided by the interviewer. Once again, we discussed the time and space complexities of both solutions.Round-3: The subsequent round was the Hiring Manager interview. The interviewer reviewed my resume, seeking deeper insights into my background. We engaged in a productive conversation that explored various aspects of my experience. Furthermore, the interviewer presented me with a design question. I provided client-side and server-side solutions.Note: For SDE-1 positions, in most companies including Amazon, design questions are not asked. I communicated it to the HM and he acknowledged it in the interview round itself.Round-4: The final round was the Bar Raiser interview, where I faced two additional DSA problems. I confidently presented my solutions and explained the time and space complexities associated with each one. Towards the end of the interview, the interviewer delved into behavioural questions.Note: The sequence of the Bar Raiser and Hiring Manager rounds may vary in different cases.If you're eager to learn more about interview tips or want to discuss any aspects of my experience, feel free to reach out to me here on LinkedIn or on topmate.io. I have also shared valuable insights for interviews in my previous posts, do check them out :) #interview

🔥🔥💥Unlocking True Happiness💥🔥🔥💥In a world that constantly bombards us with messages about finding happiness externally, it's important to remember that true happiness lies within us.💥Let's take a moment to reflect on the power of little moments in our lives. Each day presents countless opportunities for us to create our own happiness.💥It's not about waiting for happiness to magically appear, but rather about actively cultivating it in our daily lives.💥So, how can we start creating our own happiness? Here are a few ideas to get you started:1. Practice gratitude: Take a moment each day to appreciate the small things that bring you joy and express gratitude for them.2 .Embrace mindfulness: Be present in the moment and fully engage with your surroundings. Find joy in the simple pleasures of life.3 .Nurture relationships: Connect with loved ones, spread positivity, and create meaningful connections. The happiness we share with others multiplies.4. Pursue passions: Dedicate time to activities that bring you joy and fulfillment. Whether it's a hobby, a side project, or a personal goal, prioritize what makes your heart sing.Remember, happiness is not a destination but a journey. It's a mindset that we can cultivate by appreciating the little moments and actively shaping our experiences.Let's inspire each other to create our own happiness and spread positivity in our professional and personal lives. I got a job. After 40 interviews and what has to be hundreds and hundreds of applications, it finally worked out.Here are 9 things I learned during my job search after my layoff:1. Ensure your resume is compatible w/ applicant tracking systems. I had no idea this was a thing until I worked specifically with a resume writer, but given the sheer volume of applicants, having a resume that is automatically parsable by internal systems makes a difference.2. Daily goals. Setting daily goals helped me maintain a balance and create a routine as I was applying. For me personally, these included applying to at least 5 jobs daily, not turning on the TV until after 5pm, and spending at least an hour a day reading or learning something new. This helped create structure during an unpredictable period.3. Apply daily and filter on the last 24 hrs. Given the market, some jobs I applied for had 300+ applicants. To combat this, on a day to day basis, filter your search to jobs posted in the last 24 hrs. By doing so, I was usually within the first few to apply for a job, which helped get my foot in the door. Baking this into your daily routine makes it a lot less overwhelming to apply for positions, as there are fewer postings you need to scroll through every day.4. Nationwide vs city filters for remote jobs. If you are open to remote work, have separate alerts for your overall country as well as your individual city. A lot of remote jobs don’t show up in city specific listings.5. Flexible title searching. Position titles change across companies, so don’t just limit it to a single title search. Have a job search going for the specific title you are aiming for, but also have an alert that filters a more generic title e.g. “Product Manager”, with additional filtering on experience level. 6. Responses come in waves. There will be weeks where you won't hear anything, and a week will come up where you hear from multiple places all at once. Remain patient, and know that responses and interview requests will come in batches.7. Compensation. Ask for the compensation range during your first call. Interview processes are extremely lengthy and time consuming, make sure that at the end of the line if you were to receive an offer, it would match your expectations.8. Culture & fit. While we’re the ones applying for a job, its important to make sure that the company is a good fit for us as well. We spend so much of our time at work, so it's important to ask and assess things such as work culture, team dynamic, and manager personality and philosophy.9. Take time to relax. This is the most important. It's ok to do nothing for a bit. It's ok to take time out of your day and do something that brings you joy. It's ok to not have everything you do on a day to day basis be related to finding a job or bettering yourself. Extended time away from work, no matter the circumstances, doesn't come around often - use it well.#jobsearch #layoffs #jobhunt #hiring #jobhelp

Happy Monday Morning, network! It's taken me a while to make a post, but back in March I was one of the masses that was affected by Meta's layoffs. Getting that email - my heart sunk. I dodged the first rounds of layoffs, and was so hopeful I would get to keep my dream job. But when that morning did come, that email stung more than I expected it to.The past few months have been harder than I anticipated. Part of me believed that working at Meta and having a stellar track record would help me glide into my next role, but it wasn't long before I realized that I was up against many of my extremely talented colleagues and friends in every interview I went into.It's a challenge to make yourself stick out or when so many of us in the same industry are reaching for help. Heck, I even feel bold enough to tag my former manager James Hudson to testify to my abilities! (Side note, if you ever get managed by James, you might be one of the luckiest people out there)So here I am, y'all! Taking courses to better my recruiting skills for when that next dream job comes my way, and reaching out to all of you for leads and help along the way.If you know of anyone that's looking for a Talent Partner that's an ambitious and enthusiastic collaborator, or can help you achieve a well rounded workforce; here I am! I'm always ready for a challenge, a phone call, or a lead.Cheers to this wild road, and everyone that helps lead me down it!#layoffs #jobseeker #recruiting #talent #diversity #ihopethisworks

📝A unified vision lies at the core of a successful team, and conversely, an unsuccessful team is devoid of a unified vision leading to failure in the long run. 🎯Some lessons to learn derived from this post are:➡️ Best-selling author John Maxwell once said, "True team—one whose members work together to achieve greatness—has a unified vision.” ➡️What John means by “vision” is a purpose and direction that everyone on the team understands and knows that what they're doing will help to achieve that purpose in the long run.➡️ Effective teamwork starts with the Mastery of these 7 skills:1) Active communication 2) Collaboration and mutual support3) Goal setting and system creation4) Decision making5) Problem-solving6) Emotional intelligence 7) Growth mindset➡️A team environment allows individuals to bring their diverse perspectives to problem-solving, which in turn increases their success at arriving at solutions more efficiently and effectively.Do you think a unified vision is important for the success of a particular team?#teamworkmakesthedreamwork #vision

Micro-Manage is Micro-Damage to the Culture. Dynamic and Agile leader should never Micro-manage.Recent article in TOI suggests the same Not micro-managing your team can bring several advantages:1. Employee Empowerment: By avoiding micro-management, you allow your team members to take ownership of their work and make decisions. This promotes a sense of empowerment, boosts their confidence, and encourages creativity and innovation.2. Improved Productivity: When employees have autonomy and the freedom to work in their own style, they can utilize their skills and expertise more effectively. This often leads to increased productivity as they can focus on their work without unnecessary interruptions or rigid controls.3. Enhanced Morale and Engagement: Trusting your team to handle their tasks without constant supervision fosters a positive work environment. It shows that you value their abilities and trust them to deliver results. This can improve employee morale, job satisfaction, and overall engagement.4. Professional Growth: Micromanagement can stifle professional growth as it limits employees' opportunities to learn and develop new skills. Allowing individuals to take on challenges, make mistakes, and learn from them promotes continuous learning and personal growth within the team.5. Time Management: By refraining from excessive monitoring, you can allocate your time more effectively. Rather than focusing on minute details, you can concentrate on strategic planning, building relationships, and addressing larger organizational goals.6. Collaboration and Teamwork: A non-micromanaging approach encourages collaboration and teamwork. When employees have the freedom to communicate, share ideas, and contribute to the decision-making process, it strengthens the overall dynamics of the team and promotes a culture of collaboration.7. Retention and Recruitment: A supportive work environment with less micro-management tends to attract and retain talented employees. Professionals seek autonomy, trust, and opportunities for growth. By offering these qualities, you can build a strong team and reduce turnover.Remember, effective leadership involves providing guidance, setting clear expectations, and being available for support when needed, while still giving your team the autonomy they need to thrive.

A complete telecom tower can be well-defined as a complete set of #electronic signal processing unit and mechanical structures to be able to connect through these towers. The towers can differ in height from ranges such as 15-60 meters as well as higher based on the area in which they are located and for numerous proposes.𝐈𝐧 𝐃𝐞𝐭𝐚𝐢𝐥𝐬 | 𝐃𝐨𝐰𝐧𝐥𝐨𝐚𝐝 𝐅𝐫𝐞𝐞 𝐑𝐞𝐬𝐞𝐚𝐫𝐜𝐡 𝐒𝐚𝐦𝐩𝐥𝐞: https://bit.ly/43Z6Pa3Lattice telecom towers are three-legged towers, with rounded leg components and cylindrical supporting individuals. They are utilized transparently if there should be an occurrence of heavy load, which makes them reasonable for MW backbone sites in hurricane zones and central communication hubs. The primary motivation behind setting up a lattice telecom tower in a telecom network is to help more than one reception apparatus for correspondence purposes. Lattice telecom towers locate their essential applications in GSM/CDMA gear, video surveillance hardware, and radars. They can be utilized as radio towers, power transmission towers or as a perception tower. Steel towers are also in high demand due to the fastest expanding telecommunications business. Imagine if a company made water out of air. Uravu Labs did it.They’re making 1,000 litres of water out of thin air every single day.You may think this is impossible, but two students of NIT Calicut have made it possible.The story dates back to Uravu Labs founders Swapnil Shrivastav and Venkatesh RY's  college days when a drought-like situation forced them to think about the water scarcity problem. Hence, they were determined to find a sustainable solution to this prevailing problem. Water scarcity is a significant problem in our country. According to a report, water scarcity in India is expected to rise from 933 million in 2016 to 1.7 to 2.4 billion by 2050.This is an alarming situation, yet most people are unaware of it.→ Although water returned to the campus after a month, their thirst for solving the problem didn’t die. That’s how the water tech startup ‘Uravu Labs’ was founded in 2017.→ After months of research, they considered making water out of thin air. This process was familiar to the world- countries like Israel and the USA had already been making water with thin air. However, the production cost needed to be lowered, and according to the duo, high production costs were never an option. Hence, they needed to find another way.→ The duo tried and tested every possible way to make a crude prototype using air conditioners, car radiators, etc. But luck didn't seem to be on their side. By the time the product reached its minimum viable product (MVP) stage, the duo had graduated from college. However, no one was interested in their product- it didn't look promising.→ For two years, they did not get any chance. In between, they kept working on their product and were also able to make a crude prototype. This time luck was on their side. → Uravu Labs emerged as one of the top 5 finalists of the Tata Group-backed Water Abundance XPRIZE and was granted $50,000. This was enough to set up a unit and work on this project full-time.→ The duo welcomed Pardeep Garg and BALAJI GB as co-founders of the water tech startup in 2018.→ Uravu Labs plans to produce 1 lakh litres of water in the next 24 months, with its current capacity of 1,000 litres daily.Will Uravu Labs bring a permanent solution to the water scarcity problem that exists not only in India but also in the world?#tech #startup #waterconservation

What happens when something fearful is in front of you?What is your instant reaction?Do you feel like turning your back, and run away?▪️Fear, and anxiety are closely related.When you experience an unknown threat, you get anxious; whereas, you get afraid when you find something dangerous, which is known to you.▪️Some people remain afraid all the time. This is a symptom of anxiety disorder. It stems from chronic stress.▪️In some extreme cases, like in the case of Agoraphobia -- a type of anxiety disorder, people start avoiding situations or places, which are associated with unpleasant experiences or memories. They're afraid that, they might get trapped, or have a panic attack. ▪️Fight your fears. Don't run away.▪️These are simple ways to address your fears 👇🏼⏺️ Breathe -- deep breathing.⏺️ Confess to yourself that you're afraid, and anxious or stressed.⏺️ Think of something beautiful.⏺️ Ask yourself what is making you uncomfortable -- is it FEAR or F.E.A.R.  (False Evidence Appearing Real)?▪️Watch this video. A giant whale is almost near to the woman. Her body language shows that, she's not at all afraid. See she is totally calm, and composed.▪️Of course this doesn't happen naturally to everyone. But everyone can try to fight fear, and anxiety. It needs will, eagerness, and practice. ▪️Regular practice of Yoga and meditation helps.In case of anxiety disorder, psychotherapy or / and medications are needed.▪️DISCLAIMER_______________Video rights belong to the owner. Got it from an open source to download.

How Nicotex Helped Me Overcome My Worst Habit and a Heartfelt Thanks to CiplaBreaking free from the clutches of a harmful addiction is no easy task. As someone who struggled with the grip of smoking, I understand the challenges and the strength it takes to break free from this habit. In my journey towards a healthier lifestyle, Nicotex, a revolutionary product from Cipla, played a pivotal role. In this article, I want to share my personal experience of how Nicotex helped me overcome my worst habit and express my heartfelt gratitude to Cipla for manufacturing such an effective solution.The Transition Phase:The journey of quitting smoking is not just about breaking the physical dependency; it also involves tackling the psychological aspects. Nicotex played a crucial role in both these aspects. The controlled nicotine release from the gum helped alleviate my cravings and reduced the intensity of withdrawal symptoms. Additionally, the act of chewing Nicotex gum provided a substitute for the oral fixation associated with smoking.Gradual Reduction:Nicotex's unique feature of gradually reducing the nicotine content over time was instrumental in my journey. I started with the appropriate nicotine strength based on my smoking habits and gradually reduced it as per the recommended plan. This step-by-step approach allowed my body and mind to adjust to decreasing nicotine levels without experiencing severe withdrawal symptoms.The Road to Freedom:After consistent efforts and with the aid of Nicotex, I finally managed to break free from the chains of smoking. The transformation I experienced in my overall health and well-being was remarkable. I felt a surge of energy that had been dulled for years. Quitting smoking has undoubtedly been one of the best decisions I have made for myself.Conclusion:Overcoming an addiction is a personal triumph that requires determination, support, and the right tools. Nicotex, with its unique formulation and gradual reduction approach, provided me with the necessary support to break free from the clutches of smoking. It not only helped manage my cravings but also played a vital role in addressing the psychological aspects of quitting. Indeed, pencil art can be incredibly beautiful.The fine lines, delicate shading, and intricate details created through pencil drawings can evoke a sense of elegance, realism, and artistic expression.Pencil art has a unique charm that captures the essence of the subject matter and showcases the skill and creativity of the artist.The monochromatic nature of pencil drawings allows for a focus on form, texture, and contrast, which can result in visually stunning artwork.Whether it's a portrait capturing the emotions and nuances of a person's face, a still life drawing with intricate details and textures of objects, or a landscape conveying a sense of depth and atmosphere, pencil art has the ability to captivate viewers and evoke an emotional response.Moreover, pencil art offers a timeless quality. The black and white tones and the classic look of pencil drawings can transcend trends and fads, allowing them to maintain their beauty and relevance over time.Whether it's the realism, the expressive lines, or the artistic interpretation, pencil art indeed possesses a unique beauty that continues to captivate and inspire both artists and art enthusiasts alike.Follow Harshit Srivastava for more such creative content!#art #artist #creativity #pencildrawing #artwork

🎡 Importance of Preparing Well Before an Interview 🎡Preparing thoroughly before an interview is crucial as it significantly increases your chances of success and helps you make a positive impression on the hiring manager. Adequate preparation allows you to showcase your ✅Skills✅Knowledge ✅EnthusiasmEnabling you to stand out from other candidates. Here are some key reasons why it is important to prepare well before an interview:1️⃣ Confidence Booster: Preparation instills confidence in you. The more you research and practice, the better equipped you are to answer questions and discuss your qualifications.2️⃣ Understanding the Company: Researching the company beforehand enables you to align your responses with their values, goals, and culture.3️⃣ Tailored Responses: By preparing well, you can anticipate common interview questions and craft compelling answers tailored to your experiences and skills.4️⃣ Highlighting Relevant Achievements: Preparing for an interview gives you time to reflect on your past achievements and select the ones most relevant to the role you are applying for.5️⃣ Overcoming Nerves: Nervousness is common before interviews, but thorough preparation helps alleviate anxiety. As you become more familiar with potential questions and practice your responses, you'll feel more at ease and perform better during the actual interview.To better prepare for an interview, consider the following tips:📌 Research the company: Learn about its mission, values, recent achievements, and any industry trends or news.📌 Understand the role: Analyze the job description and identify the key skills and qualifications required. Align your experiences and achievements with those requirements.📌 Practice common questions: Prepare concise, impactful responses to commonly asked interview questions. Use the STAR method (Situation, Task, Action, Result) to structure your answers.📌 Conduct mock interviews: Practice with a friend or mentor who can simulate the interview environment and provide constructive feedback.📌 Dress professionally: Select appropriate attire that aligns with the company's culture and dress code.📌 Plan logistics: Determine the interview location and make sure you have all necessary equipment and documents ready.In terms of preparing a routine for interview preparation, consider allocating dedicated time each day or week leading up to the interview. This routine may include:✅Researching the company and role✅Practicing interview questions✅Refining your responsesAdditionally, devote time to enhancing your knowledge of the industry and rehearsing your elevator pitch.Remember, preparation is the key to success in any endeavor, and interviews are no exception. By investing #time and #effort into thorough #preparation, you can enter an #interview with✅Confidence✅Which will increase your chances of landing the job you desireSave this post and follow me Rahul Pandey 👨‍💻⚡for more.

I got a job. After 40 interviews and what has to be hundreds and hundreds of applications, it finally worked out.Here are 9 things I learned during my job search after my layoff:1. Ensure your resume is compatible w/ applicant tracking systems. I had no idea this was a thing until I worked specifically with a resume writer, but given the sheer volume of applicants, having a resume that is automatically parsable by internal systems makes a difference.2. Daily goals. Setting daily goals helped me maintain a balance and create a routine as I was applying. For me personally, these included applying to at least 5 jobs daily, not turning on the TV until after 5pm, and spending at least an hour a day reading or learning something new. This helped create structure during an unpredictable period.3. Apply daily and filter on the last 24 hrs. Given the market, some jobs I applied for had 300+ applicants. To combat this, on a day to day basis, filter your search to jobs posted in the last 24 hrs. By doing so, I was usually within the first few to apply for a job, which helped get my foot in the door. Baking this into your daily routine makes it a lot less overwhelming to apply for positions, as there are fewer postings you need to scroll through every day.4. Nationwide vs city filters for remote jobs. If you are open to remote work, have separate alerts for your overall country as well as your individual city. A lot of remote jobs don’t show up in city specific listings.5. Flexible title searching. Position titles change across companies, so don’t just limit it to a single title search. Have a job search going for the specific title you are aiming for, but also have an alert that filters a more generic title e.g. “Product Manager”, with additional filtering on experience level. 6. Responses come in waves. There will be weeks where you won't hear anything, and a week will come up where you hear from multiple places all at once. Remain patient, and know that responses and interview requests will come in batches.7. Compensation. Ask for the compensation range during your first call. Interview processes are extremely lengthy and time consuming, make sure that at the end of the line if you were to receive an offer, it would match your expectations.8. Culture & fit. While we’re the ones applying for a job, its important to make sure that the company is a good fit for us as well. We spend so much of our time at work, so it's important to ask and assess things such as work culture, team dynamic, and manager personality and philosophy.9. Take time to relax. This is the most important. It's ok to do nothing for a bit. It's ok to take time out of your day and do something that brings you joy. It's ok to not have everything you do on a day to day basis be related to finding a job or bettering yourself. Extended time away from work, no matter the circumstances, doesn't come around often - use it well.#jobsearch #layoffs #jobhunt #hiring #jobhelp

Mind your Mind “Don’t let others ruin your happiness”, one of my friends told me while referring to the constant politics at the office. Most of the times political correctness is important to succeed than mere performance. That’s a fact. At times we take the office scene way too seriously. The value of earning a livelihood most of the times is overestimated. Probably, it’s the attachment to our posts and positions which doesn’t allow us to see ourselves out of the office setting.I too like many other professionals struggle with this challenge. The only good thing is I have started to notice it more often than before. I can’t stop the mind from thinking but what definitely I can control is the focus of my thinking 🧐 The epic text Bhagavad Gita explains मन्मना भव मद्भ‍क्तो मद्याजी मां नमस्कुरु ।मामेवैष्यसि युक्त्वैवमात्मानं मत्परायण: ॥ Engage your mind always in thinking of Me, become My devotee, offer obeisances to Me and worship Me. Being completely absorbed in Me, surely you will come to Me.(9.34)So the key is the ‘engagement/focus of the mind’. By shifting our focus we will able to free our mind and ourselves from the artificial shackles which is binding us. When you change your focus your goals and attachments automatically change. Here’s what can help us from coming out of that vicious circle ⭕️ 1. Mantra Meditation relaxes the mind like anything. It’s kind of reset the whole system. Do it for 10 mins to begin with everyday 🧘‍♂️ 2. Make a list of 10 things which your profession can’t provide you. You will be shocked to see the list has the most important things of our life. 3. Improve your engagement level at places other than office - home, social centre, gym, temple etc. Open up more avenues for your mind. 4. Last but not the least - READ BOOKS regularly. It stimulates the deep inherent power of the mind like anything. Don’t stop thinking 🤔 or try to become thoughtless you can’t do that, just shift the focus of your thoughts. #corporatemythology #mindfulness #leadershipsutras

Imagine if a company made water out of air. Uravu Labs did it.They’re making 1,000 litres of water out of thin air every single day.You may think this is impossible, but two students of NIT Calicut have made it possible.The story dates back to Uravu Labs founders Swapnil Shrivastav and Venkatesh RY's  college days when a drought-like situation forced them to think about the water scarcity problem. Hence, they were determined to find a sustainable solution to this prevailing problem. Water scarcity is a significant problem in our country. According to a report, water scarcity in India is expected to rise from 933 million in 2016 to 1.7 to 2.4 billion by 2050.This is an alarming situation, yet most people are unaware of it.→ Although water returned to the campus after a month, their thirst for solving the problem didn’t die. That’s how the water tech startup ‘Uravu Labs’ was founded in 2017.→ After months of research, they considered making water out of thin air. This process was familiar to the world- countries like Israel and the USA had already been making water with thin air. However, the production cost needed to be lowered, and according to the duo, high production costs were never an option. Hence, they needed to find another way.→ The duo tried and tested every possible way to make a crude prototype using air conditioners, car radiators, etc. But luck didn't seem to be on their side. By the time the product reached its minimum viable product (MVP) stage, the duo had graduated from college. However, no one was interested in their product- it didn't look promising.→ For two years, they did not get any chance. In between, they kept working on their product and were also able to make a crude prototype. This time luck was on their side. → Uravu Labs emerged as one of the top 5 finalists of the Tata Group-backed Water Abundance XPRIZE and was granted $50,000. This was enough to set up a unit and work on this project full-time.→ The duo welcomed Pardeep Garg and BALAJI GB as co-founders of the water tech startup in 2018.→ Uravu Labs plans to produce 1 lakh litres of water in the next 24 months, with its current capacity of 1,000 litres daily.Will Uravu Labs bring a permanent solution to the water scarcity problem that exists not only in India but also in the world?#tech #startup #waterconservation

Micro-Manage is Micro-Damage to the Culture. Dynamic and Agile leader should never Micro-manage.Recent article in TOI suggests the same Not micro-managing your team can bring several advantages:1. Employee Empowerment: By avoiding micro-management, you allow your team members to take ownership of their work and make decisions. This promotes a sense of empowerment, boosts their confidence, and encourages creativity and innovation.2. Improved Productivity: When employees have autonomy and the freedom to work in their own style, they can utilize their skills and expertise more effectively. This often leads to increased productivity as they can focus on their work without unnecessary interruptions or rigid controls.3. Enhanced Morale and Engagement: Trusting your team to handle their tasks without constant supervision fosters a positive work environment. It shows that you value their abilities and trust them to deliver results. This can improve employee morale, job satisfaction, and overall engagement.4. Professional Growth: Micromanagement can stifle professional growth as it limits employees' opportunities to learn and develop new skills. Allowing individuals to take on challenges, make mistakes, and learn from them promotes continuous learning and personal growth within the team.5. Time Management: By refraining from excessive monitoring, you can allocate your time more effectively. Rather than focusing on minute details, you can concentrate on strategic planning, building relationships, and addressing larger organizational goals.6. Collaboration and Teamwork: A non-micromanaging approach encourages collaboration and teamwork. When employees have the freedom to communicate, share ideas, and contribute to the decision-making process, it strengthens the overall dynamics of the team and promotes a culture of collaboration.7. Retention and Recruitment: A supportive work environment with less micro-management tends to attract and retain talented employees. Professionals seek autonomy, trust, and opportunities for growth. By offering these qualities, you can build a strong team and reduce turnover.Remember, effective leadership involves providing guidance, setting clear expectations, and being available for support when needed, while still giving your team the autonomy they need to thrive.

Mind your Mind “Don’t let others ruin your happiness”, one of my friends told me while referring to the constant politics at the office. Most of the times political correctness is important to succeed than mere performance. That’s a fact. At times we take the office scene way too seriously. The value of earning a livelihood most of the times is overestimated. Probably, it’s the attachment to our posts and positions which doesn’t allow us to see ourselves out of the office setting.I too like many other professionals struggle with this challenge. The only good thing is I have started to notice it more often than before. I can’t stop the mind from thinking but what definitely I can control is the focus of my thinking 🧐 The epic text Bhagavad Gita explains मन्मना भव मद्भ‍क्तो मद्याजी मां नमस्कुरु ।मामेवैष्यसि युक्त्वैवमात्मानं मत्परायण: ॥ Engage your mind always in thinking of Me, become My devotee, offer obeisances to Me and worship Me. Being completely absorbed in Me, surely you will come to Me.(9.34)So the key is the ‘engagement/focus of the mind’. By shifting our focus we will able to free our mind and ourselves from the artificial shackles which is binding us. When you change your focus your goals and attachments automatically change. Here’s what can help us from coming out of that vicious circle ⭕️ 1. Mantra Meditation relaxes the mind like anything. It’s kind of reset the whole system. Do it for 10 mins to begin with everyday 🧘‍♂️ 2. Make a list of 10 things which your profession can’t provide you. You will be shocked to see the list has the most important things of our life. 3. Improve your engagement level at places other than office - home, social centre, gym, temple etc. Open up more avenues for your mind. 4. Last but not the least - READ BOOKS regularly. It stimulates the deep inherent power of the mind like anything. Don’t stop thinking 🤔 or try to become thoughtless you can’t do that, just shift the focus of your thoughts. #corporatemythology #mindfulness #leadershipsutras

Back to back interviews.Not a single candidate was meeting the expectations of the jury. Everyone seemed underconfident and nervous. Those who were confident didn't have the skills and practical knowledge. We were heading towards the end of the hiring session.Then a guy entered, he was a fresher and seemed very confident from his body language.As the interview went on, he performed really well.Me : "How did you prepare yourself for the interview?"Candidate : "I used to do mock interviews with other candidates."I was very impressed with this habit of the candidate. Mock interview sessions really help the candidate to develop confidence and good answering skills.He was hired !Whenever you are preparing for an interview always try to practice the probable questions and participate in mock interviews. It will really help you to boost your confidence.#hiring #hr #help #interview #mock #hired #job #jobopportunity #freshershiring

I feel sympathy for the 22,500 employees of Credit Suisse who are about to lose their jobs https://lnkd.in/gS575ai9.  Some of them have no doubt lost a significant portion of their savings also, due to 401k plan investments, deferred compensation, etc.  At one time, Credit Suisse was a world-class firm, highly regarded by competitors and customers alike.  And in different ways, this will be a painful, awful experience for all CS former employees living through this transition, just as it was for the thousands of people (myself included) who lost their jobs when Bear Stearns hit the wall in 2008.  Nobody likes losing their job, but when a firm collapses in ignominious fashion, it is especially difficult.  As with the Bear collapse and the Lehman bankruptcy, reputations have been damaged.  But you are not your firm, and you are not your firm's incompetent management (unless you are, in fact, the management, in which case you should be ashamed of yourselves).   Wall Street is great at creative destruction, so if you work hard, remain modest, and focus on your customers, you will be able to rebuild your career.   #creditsuisse #ubs #layoffs #wallstreet #transitions

📝Taking stand for others is an act of social responsibility and selflessness 🎯Some lessons to derive from this post:➡️Bryan Stevenson once said, "We are all implicated when we allow other people to be mistreated.
